sv.purpose: Att uppskatta och registrera svårighetsgrad av ångest.
sv.use:
Använd för att uppskatta och registrera svårighetsgrad av ångest.

Hamilton Anxiety Scale används för att uppskatta och registrera svårighetsgrad av ångest, i syfte att utvärdera och bedöma nya patienter samt följa utveckling över tid. Formuläret består av 14 områden: 
1. Ängslighet
2. Spändhet
3. Rädslor
4. Sömnproblem
5. Kognition
6. Depressiva symtom
7. Somatik (muskulärt)
8. Somatik (sensoriskt)
9. Kardiovaskulära symtom
10. Luftvägsbesvär
11. Gastrointestinala besvär
12. Urinvägsbesvär
13. Autonoma symtom
14. Beteende vid samtal

Varje område graderas på en skala 0-4 enligt:
0 - frånvarande
1 - lindrigt
2 - måttligt
3 - svårt
4 - mycket svårt

Totala poängen uppgår således till maximalt 56p. Resultatet utvärderas med avseende på allvarlighetsgrad, där ≤17p indikerar lindrig, 18-24p lindrig till måttligt, 25-30p måttlig till svår och >30p svår ångest.

en.purpose: To rate and register severity of anxiety.
en.use:
Use to rate and register severity of anxiety.

The Hamilton Anxiety Scale is used to rate severity of anxiety, in order to assess new patients as well as track severity of condition over time. It consists of 14 items:
1. Anxious mood
2. Tension
3. Fears
4. Insomnia
5. Intellectual
6. Depressed mood
7. Somatic (muscular)
8. Somatic (sensory)
9. Cardiovascular symptoms
10. Respiratory symptoms
11. Gastrointestinal symptoms
12. Genitourinary symptoms
13. Autonomic symptoms
14. Behavior at interview

It is rated on a scale from zero to four:

0 - not present
1 - mild
2 - moderate
3 - severe
4 - very severe

The maximum total score thus amounts to 56p. The score is rated per severity of condition, where ≤17p indicates mild, 18-24p mild to moderate, 25-30p moderate to severe and >30 severe anxiety.

other_details.references:

Maier W, Buller R, Philipp M, Heuser I. The Hamilton Anxiety Scale: reliability, validity and sensitivity to change in anxiety and depressive disorders. J Affect Disord 1988;14(1):61–8.

gt0004.description: Worries, anticipation of the worst, fearful anticipation, irritability.

gt0005.description: Feelings of tension, fatigability, startle response, moved to tears easily, trembling, feelings of restlessness, inability to relax.

gt0006.description: Of dark, of strangers, of being left alone, of animals, of traffic, of crowds.

gt0007.description: Difficulty in falling asleep, broken sleep, unsatisfying sleep and fatigue on waking, dreams, nightmares, night terrors.

gt0009.description: Loss of interest, lack of pleasure in hobbies, depression, early waking, diurnal swing.

gt0010.description: Pains and aches, twitching, stiffness, myoclonic jerks, grinding of teeth, unsteady voice, increased muscular tone.

gt0011.description: Tinnitus, blurring of vision, hot and cold flushes, feelings of weakness, pricking sensation.

gt0012.description: Tachycardia, palpitations, pain in chest, throbbing of vessels, fainting feelings, missing beat.

gt0013.description: Pressure or constriction in chest, choking feelings, sighing, dyspnea.

gt0014.description: Difficulty in swallowing, wind abdominal pain, burning sensations, abdominal fullness, nausea, vomiting, borborygmi, looseness of bowels, loss of weight, constipation.

gt0015.description: Difficulty in swallowing, wind abdominal pain, burning sensations, abdominal fullness, nausea, vomiting, borborygmi, looseness of bowels, loss of weight, constipation.

gt0016.description: Dry mouth, flushing, pallor, tendency to sweat, giddiness, tension headache, raising of hair.

gt0017.description: Fidgeting, restlessness or pacing, tremor of hands, furrowed brow, strained face, sighing or rapid respiration, facial pallor, swallowing, etc.

gt0050.description: Assessment of score generated in accordance with the Hamilton Anxiety Scale.
